alternative_parents.description: Organic salt compounds containing a transition metal atom in its ionic form.
alternative_parents.name: Organic transition metal salts

alternative_parents.description: Organometallic compounds with the generic formula R-M-X, where R is an alkyl group, and X is a metal atom.
alternative_parents.name: Metal alkyl halides

alternative_parents.description: Metal alkyls, where the alkyl group is attached to a transition metal atom.
alternative_parents.name: Transition metal alkyls

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organometallic compounds containing an alkyl group attached to a mercury atom.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl mercury compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl fluoride functional group with formula R-F , where R is an alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl fluorides

class.description: Organic compounds containing a linear aliphatic chain (or ring system) carrying a C-X bond, where X is a halogen atom.
class.name: Alkyl halides

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as trihalomethanes. These are organic compounds in which exactly three of the four hydrogen atoms of methane (CH4) are replaced by halogen atoms.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds in which exactly three of the four hydrogen atoms of methane (CH4) are replaced by halogen atoms.
direct_parent.name: Trihalomethanes

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds in which at least one of the four hydrogen atoms of methane (CH4) are replaced by halogen atoms.
subclass.name: Halomethanes

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and a halogen atom (At, F, Cl, Br, I).
superclass.name: Organohalogen compounds
